qas.question: Who was the leader of the Iceni tribe?
What was Roman London's population in the 2nd century?
The Romans invaded what is now London and established its first major settlement in what year?
What was the capital of Britannia before Londinium?
Who invaded and destroyed the first major settlement of Roman London in 61 AD?

context: Although there is evidence of scattered Brythonic settlements in the area, the first major settlement was founded by the Romans after the invasion of <a2_0>43 AD<a2_0/>. This lasted only until around 61, when <a4_0>the Iceni tribe<a4_0/> led by <a0_0>Queen Boudica<a0_0/> stormed it, burning it to the ground. The next, heavily planned, incarnation of Londinium prospered, and it superseded <a3_0>Colchester<a3_0/> as the capital of the Roman province of Britannia in 100. At its height in the 2nd century, Roman London had a population of <a1_0>around 60,000<a1_0/>.
